metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2277 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The make_temporary_filename function in perltidy 20120701-1 and earlier allows local users to obtain sensitive information or write to arbitrary files via a symlink attack, related to use of the tmpnam function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2277` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

perltidy - 20140328-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: perltidy package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20140328-1').
